snippet: The shooting of Usaamah Abdullah Rahim suddenly revealed what officials described as a lengthy terrorism investigation, with several agencies looking into an alleged murder plot.
abstract: Fatal shooting of Usaamah Abdullah Rahim in Boston after he threatened police and an FBI agent reveals lengthy federal investigation of his terrorist activities; officials say Rahim was radicalized by militant Islam websites, inflaming fears about influence of foreign extremists on homegrown radicals.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and DAVE PHILIPPS
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Boston, and Dave Philipps from New York. Katharine Q. Seelye and Scott Shane contributed reporting from Boston.

lead_paragraph: The shooting of Usaamah Abdullah Rahim suddenly revealed what officials described as a lengthy terrorism investigation, with several agencies looking into an alleged murder plot.

headline.main: Boston Terror Suspect’s Shooting Highlights Concerns Over Reach of ISIS
headline.print_headline: Shooting of Terror Suspect Revives Memories of Bombing Trauma in Boston

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
